alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 07 at 10:50AM MST until November 07 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches with local amounts to 9 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting 35 to 45 mph. * WHERE...Eastport, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Sandpoint, Athol, Priest River, and Bonners Ferry. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Winter travel conditions are expected during the Monday evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down small tree branches. Drifting snow will be possible Monday night into Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
